net.dean.jraw.http.oauth

Class OAuthHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.dean.jraw.http.oauth.OAuthHelper

  • public class OAuthHelper
extends java.lang.Object

    This class assists developers using this library in authenticating users via OAuth2. For the app types of 'installed' or 'web', a typical use of this class is as follows:

    1. Obtain an authorization URL using getAuthorizationUrl(Credentials, boolean, String...).
    2. Point the user's browser to that URL and have the user login and then press either 'yes' or 'no' on the authentication form. The URL that the browser redirects to will be your app's redirect URI with some arguments in the query.
    3. Provide this data as well as an instance of Credentials to onUserChallenge(String, Credentials). This method will parse the query arguments and report any errors. Once the response's integrity has been verified, a request to obtain the OAuth access code will be made and an instance of OAuthData retrieved.

    Authentication is simpler when the app type is 'script', as this enables the bypassing of showing the initial authorization URL to the user. However, it comes at the cost of only being able to log into the accounts of users registered as "developers." To authenticate with a 'script' app or in a userless context, one may simply use easyAuth(Credentials).

    • Method Detail

      • getAuthorizationUrl

        public java.net.URL getAuthorizationUrl(Credentials creds,
                               boolean permanent,
                               java.lang.String... scopes)
        Generates a URL used to authorize a user using OAuth2 'installed' or 'web' type app.
        Parameters:
        creds - The app's credentials
        permanent - Whether or not to request a refresh token which can be exchanged for an additional authorization token in the future.
        scopes - OAuth scopes to be requested. A full list of scopes can be found here.
        Returns:
        The URL clients are sent to in order to authorize themselves

      • onUserChallenge

        public OAuthData onUserChallenge(java.lang.String finalUrl,
                        Credentials creds)
                          throws NetworkException,
                                 OAuthException,
                                 java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Used obtain an access token for 'web' or 'installed' app types. This method parses the query arguments passed to this URI. If no error is present and the 'state' code matches the one most recently generated, then an access token is requested.
        Parameters:
        finalUrl - The URL that the HTTP client redirected to after the user chose either to authorize or not authorize the application. This will be the app's redirect URI with the addition of a few query parameters.
        creds - The credentials to retrieve the access token with. If the authorization method is AuthenticationMethod.SCRIPT or application-only, stop what you're doing and use easyAuth(Credentials) instead.
        Returns:
        An OAuthData that holds the new access token among other things
        Throws:
        OAuthException - If there was a problem with any of the parameters given
        NetworkException - If the request was not successful
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the state last generated with getAuthorizationUrl(net.dean.jraw.http.oauth.Credentials, boolean, java.lang.String...) did not match the value of the 'state' query parameter.

      • easyAuth

        public OAuthData easyAuth(Credentials creds)
                   throws NetworkException,
                          OAuthException
        Authorizes a 'script' app or any other in application-only (user-less) mode.
        Returns:
        A new OAuthData representing the access token response
        Throws:
        NetworkException - If the request was not successful. If the HTTP status code is 403, then it is likely that the Credentials object provided had incorrect data.
        OAuthException - If the API returned a JSON error. Only thrown when using application-only authentication.

      • revokeAccessToken

        public void revokeAccessToken(Credentials creds)
                       throws NetworkException
        Revokes the OAuth2 access token. You will need to login again to continue using this client without error.
        Parameters:
        creds - The credentials to use. The username and password are irrelevant; only the client ID and secret will be used.
        Throws:
        NetworkException - If the request was not successful

      • revokeRefreshToken

        public void revokeRefreshToken(Credentials creds)
                        throws NetworkException
        Revokes the OAuth2 refresh token. You will need to have the user reauthenticate using getAuthorizationUrl(net.dean.jraw.http.oauth.Credentials, boolean, java.lang.String...).
        Parameters:
        creds - The credentials used to request the original token
        Throws:
        NetworkException

      • refreshToken

        public OAuthData refreshToken(Credentials creds)
                       throws NetworkException,
                              OAuthException
        Refreshes the access token. Must have requested an access token when calling getAuthorizationUrl(net.dean.jraw.http.oauth.Credentials, boolean, java.lang.String...).
        Parameters:
        creds - The credentials used to request the original access token. Only the client ID and client secret will be used.
        Returns:
        A new OAuthData
        Throws:
        OAuthException - If the client ID or secret was incorrect
        NetworkException

      • getRefreshToken

        public java.lang.String getRefreshToken()
        Gets the token that will allow the client to get more access tokens

      • setRefreshToken

        public void setRefreshToken(java.lang.String refreshToken)
        Assigns the refresh token.
